abstract: Apple delivered $1 billion in profit for its first quarter, based largely on the Christmas performance of its iPod music player business.
snippet: Apple delivered $1 billion in profit for its first quarter, based largely on the Christmas performance of its iPod music player business.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 17  Apple Inc., sweeping past even optimistic analyst expectations, delivered $1 billion in profit for its first quarter, based largely on the Christmas performance of its iPod music player business.

abstract: ASML Holding, maker of the most expensive machines in chip fabrication, said fourth-quarter profit quadrupled on demand for semiconductors used in iPod music devices and mobile phones. Net income jumped to a record 205.5 million euros ($265.7 million), or 0.42 euro a share, from 51.6 million euros, or 0.11 euro a share, a year earlier, ASML said. Sales surged 95 percent, to a record 1.07 billion euros. The company said orders would be “healthy” in the first quarter and revenue would gain this year. Demand for Apple iPods and Motorola phones has spurred shipments of ASML’s $18 million machines to clients like Samsung Electronics, Intel and Texas Instruments. ASML is based in Veldhoven, the Netherlands.

lead_paragraph: ASML Holding, maker of the most expensive machines in chip fabrication, said fourth-quarter profit quadrupled on demand for semiconductors used in iPod music devices and mobile phones. Net income jumped to a record 205.5 million euros ($265.7 million), or 0.42 euro a share, from 51.6 million euros, or 0.11 euro a share, a year earlier, ASML said. Sales surged 95 percent, to a record 1.07 billion euros. The company said orders would be “healthy” in the first quarter and revenue would gain this year. Demand for Apple iPods and Motorola phones has spurred shipments of ASML’s $18 million machines to clients like Samsung Electronics, Intel and Texas Instruments. ASML is based in Veldhoven, the Netherlands.

abstract: Apparently, nothing effaces the stigma of a scandal like a billion-dollar profit, as BusinessWeek, looking at Apple‘s recent sales figures, points out. Buoyed by record sales of 21 million of its signature iPod digital media players, Apple reaped that billion-dollar bottom line on revenues of $7.1 billion in its fiscal first quarter. Net income surged 78 percent in the period that includes the year-end holiday season, yielding per-share profit of $1.14, Apple said Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Apparently, nothing effaces the stigma of a scandal like a billion-dollar profit, as BusinessWeek, looking at Apple‘s recent sales figures, points out. Buoyed by record sales of 21 million of its signature iPod digital media players, Apple reaped that billion-dollar bottom line on revenues of $7.1 billion in its fiscal first quarter. Net income surged 78 percent in the period that includes the year-end holiday season, yielding per-share profit of $1.14, Apple said Wednesday.

headline.main: Apple’s Stellar Results Help Options Medicine Go Down
